permissions.title: Permissions

storage.name: Storage
storage.description:
`storage`
Required for the extension to function properly, to store and retrieve data locally

contextMenu.name: Context Menu
contextMenu.description:
`contextMenus`
Firefox requires this permission to be listed in the manifest's permissions block at install time, [Read More](https://github.com/Lanshuns/Qwacky?tab=readme-ov-file#browser-specific-permission-handling-and-limitations)

contextMenuFeatures.name: Autofill
contextMenuFeatures.description:
`activeTab`, `clipboardWrite` and `scripting`
Enables "Autofill Duck Address" option in the context menu, To generate and copy duck address to the clipboard

contextMenuFeatures.chromeInfo:

firefox.step1: 1. Firefox will show a permissions request - click 'Allow'
firefox.step2: 2. Return to the extension and toggle the feature again
firefox.disableLater: You can disable this feature anytime later.

chrome.differentHandling: Chrome handles permissions differently than Firefox.
chrome.enableFeature: To enable this feature, Chrome will show a permission request once. After clicking 'Done', a permissions dialog may appear.
chrome.ifDialog: If you see a permissions dialog, click 'Allow' then return to the extension and toggle the feature again.

tooltip.info: Browser additional permissions request will only appear once if not already granted.
